solution_line_template: {jars} jars are exactly {twice_factor} the number of clay pots made by the craftsman, meaning there are {jars}/{twice_factor}=<<{jars}/{twice_factor}={clay_pots}>>{clay_pots} clay pots
If each jar has {marbles_per_jar} marbles, the total number of marbles in the jars is {marbles_per_jar}*{jars}=<<{marbles_per_jar}*{jars}={total_marbles_jars}>>{total_marbles_jars}
Each of the clay pots also has {marbles_factor_clay_pot}*{marbles_per_jar}=<<{marbles_factor_clay_pot}*{marbles_per_jar}={marbles_per_clay_pot}>>{marbles_per_clay_pot} marbles.
The total number of marbles in the {clay_pots} clay pots is {marbles_per_clay_pot}*{clay_pots}=<<{marbles_per_clay_pot}*{clay_pots}={total_marbles_clay_pots}>>{total_marbles_clay_pots}
There are a total of {total_marbles_clay_pots}+{total_marbles_jars}=<<{total_marbles_clay_pots}+{total_marbles_jars}={total_marbles}>>{total_marbles} marbles.
